author: angelmario69

text: Konami has often milked out franchises and changed the core roots of them. It has nothing to directly do with the Lords games, but more of Konami changing franchises like Goemon, Suikoden, and Silent Hill in ways that fans of the original games have a hard time resonating with. I never once said Lords of Shadow was one such franchise, which is why I said imagine. It's likely possible they can trample all over it, as it's not Hideo Kojima's baby. Those are off-limits.

author: Psydrre

text: You can "easily imagine" that Konami will ruin castlevania? Based on what? Lords of shadow(otherwise I have no idea what you base that statement on)? You do realize that the latest castlevania (lords of shadow) is more in line with the original castlevania (nes)and closer to the "roots" as you say of castlevania then symphony of night ever was? Linearity vs open world.
author: Psydrre

text: I would assume so. David Cox, the producer on the Lords games, has been known for being slippery when it came to the original game. First he said the game would not include any time of QTE sequence, but the retail game actually contains two types of QTE things. The second most notable thing literally involves God of War. He's gone on record saying there was no point in competing with GoW as CV is an older franchise, to literally saying "of course we are" just as the game was about to launch...

author: Iwannaplayssbb

text:
I hate being the bearer of bad news, but the higher ups at Konami think her contribution to Castlevania was "effeminite", and they're pushing Oscar Araujo to make a "darker" soundtrack for the Lords subseries.

I can easily imagine Konami ruining the roots of Castlevania, as they've nearly ruined every other franchise that isn't Metal Gear or Zone of the Enders in some fashion already.

text: It'd be a tragedy if Yamane never composed for Castlevania again. As excited as I am for Lords of Shadow 2, I can hardly say the same for Mirror of Fate. Yamane left Konami after she finished her work on Order of Ecclesia, she's now a freelance composer.ï»¿ Video game companies absolutely should take a look at her portfolio and give her a chance at composing music for some of their video games. She's WAY too talented to be the one looking for work and doing nothing.
